author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) which are not met ‚ùå

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an upper-case letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are upper-case.
- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- Package name similar to 22 existing packages.
  <details>
  <summary>Similar package names</summary>

  1. Similar to FCA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  2. Similar to ODE. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  3. Similar to SHA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  4. Similar to BDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  5. Similar to FDM. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  6. Similar to GDAL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  7. Similar to DSP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  8. Similar to EDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  9. Similar to MD5. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  10. Similar to XPA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  11. Similar to JDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  12. Similar to ADI. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  13. Similar to XDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  14. Similar to PDDL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  15. Similar to DSDP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  16. Similar to SDDP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  17. Similar to RDDP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  18. Similar to DCCA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  19. Similar to SDPA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  20. Similar to CUDA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  21. Similar to DINA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  22. Similar to VIDA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

  </details>


## 3. *Needs action*: here's what to do next

1. Please try to update your package to conform to these guidelines. The [General registry's README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) has an FAQ that can help figure out how to do so.
2. After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simply retrigger Registrator, the same way you did in the initial registration. This will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number).

If you need help fixing the AutoMerge issues, or want your pull request to be manually merged instead, please post a comment explaining what you need help with or why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. Then, send a message to the `#pkg-registration` channel in the [public Julia Slack](https://julialang.org/slack/) for better visibility.

## 4. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

> https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-rules

Or maybe `DDABinaryWrapper`.

Three-letter acronyms are pretty much a no-go for package names, under the [naming guidelines](https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-rules)
@goerz Got it. What about `DelayDifferentialAnalysis`? Currently, the package is a wrapper but may soon contain an actual Julia clone of the existing C implementation.
